content:
ColumnDefinitionCollection Class

Definition

Provides access to an ordered, strongly typed collection of ColumnDefinition objects.

In this Article

public sealed class ColumnDefinitionCollection : System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition>, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition>, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition>, System.Collections.IList
Inheritance
Object
ColumnDefinitionCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Properties

Count

Gets the total number of items within this instance of ColumnDefinitionCollection.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The total number of items in the collection. This property has no default value.

IsReadOnly

Gets a value that indicates whether a ColumnDefinitionCollection is read-only.

public bool IsReadOnly { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the collection is read-only; otherwise false. This property has no default value.

IsSynchronized

Gets a value that indicates whether access to this ColumnDefinitionCollection is synchronized (thread safe).

public bool IsSynchronized { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if access to this collection is synchronized; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions that result from changes made by other threads.

Item(Int32)

Gets a value that indicates the current item within a ColumnDefinitionCollection.

public System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition this[int index] { get; set; }
Parameters
index
Int32

The current item in the collection.

Value
ColumnDefinition

The element at the specified index.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is not a valid index position in the collection.

Remarks

ColumnDefinitionCollection uses a zero-based indexing system.

SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the ColumnDefinitionCollection.

public object SyncRoot { get; }
Value
Object

An object that can be used to synchronize access to the ColumnDefinitionCollection.

Remarks

Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions that result from changes made by other threads.

Adds a ColumnDefinition element to a ColumnDefinitionCollection.

Parameters

Identifies the ColumnDefinition to add to the collection.

Clears the content of the ColumnDefinitionCollection.

Contains(ColumnDefinition)

Determines whether a given ColumnDefinition exists within a ColumnDefinitionCollection.

Parameters
value

Identifies the ColumnDefinition that is being tested.

Returns
Boolean

true if the ColumnDefinition exists within the collection; otherwise false.

CopyTo(ColumnDefinition[], Int32)

Copies an array of ColumnDefinition objects to a given index position within a ColumnDefinitionCollection.

public void CopyTo (System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition[] array, int index);
Parameters
array
ColumnDefinition[]

An array of ColumnDefinition objects.

index
Int32

Identifies the index position within array to which the ColumnDefinition objects are copied.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

array is null.

ArgumentException

array is multidimensional.

-or-

The number of elements in the source ICollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than zero.

Remarks

ColumnDefinitionCollection uses a zero-based indexing system.

IndexOf(ColumnDefinition)

Returns the index position of a given ColumnDefinition within a ColumnDefinitionCollection.

public int IndexOf (System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition value);
Parameters
value
ColumnDefinition

The ColumnDefinition whose index position is desired.

Returns
Int32

The index of value if found in the collection; otherwise, -1.

Insert(Int32, ColumnDefinition)

Inserts a ColumnDefinition at the specified index position within a ColumnDefinitionCollection.

public void Insert (int index, System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition value);
Parameters
index
Int32

The position within the collection where the item is inserted.

value
ColumnDefinition

The ColumnDefinition to insert.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is not a valid index in the IList.

Remarks

ColumnDefinitionCollection uses a zero-based indexing system.

Remove(ColumnDefinition)

Removes a ColumnDefinition from a ColumnDefinitionCollection.

public bool Remove (System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition value);
Parameters
value
ColumnDefinition

The ColumnDefinition to remove from the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the ColumnDefinition was found in the collection and removed; otherwise, false.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes a ColumnDefinition from a ColumnDefinitionCollection at the specified index position.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
Parameters
index
Int32

The position within the collection at which the ColumnDefinition is removed.

Remarks

ColumnDefinitionCollection uses a zero-based indexing system.

RemoveRange(Int32, Int32)

Removes a range of ColumnDefinition objects from a ColumnDefinitionCollection.

public void RemoveRange (int index, int count);
Parameters
index
Int32

The position within the collection at which the first ColumnDefinition is removed.

count
Int32

The total number of ColumnDefinition objects to remove from the collection.

Remarks

ColumnDefinitionCollection uses a zero-based indexing system.
